ground_truth: As Ron and Harry exchange a curious glance, the bell continues to chime. At this point, the time reversal ends, and the room is empty except for Harry and Hermione. As Hermione unloops the necklace, Harry glances around in confusion while Hermione ignores the question and eyes the clock on the wall. Hermione grabs Harry's arm and slams through the door as they come to a mad, huffing halt. She holds up a hand, silencing him. Annoyed, Harry follows her gaze and blinks in disbelief as he sees himself, along with Hermione and Ron, about to confront Malfoy, Crabbe, and Goyle near the monoliths. Dumbfounded, Harry turns as Hermione holds up the hourglass. A soft smack is heard, and they turn to see Malfoy land on the seat of his pants in the Sundial Garden, rubbing his kisser. Hermione pulls Harry under the bridge, and seconds later, footsteps clamor over their heads. Seconds later, Harry emerges and marvels at the sight of himself, Hermione, and Ron heading down the slope to Hagrid's hut. His eyes shift to the pumpkin patch, and Harry nods, then looks toward the hut where Hagrid is handing Scabbers to Ron. As he starts to rise, Hermione grabs him and speaks fiercely, then watches Fudge and the others drawing closer. She frowns and glances into the hut. Just then, on the ground beside her, Hermione notices a jagged star-shaped stone and instantly grabs it, rises, and hurls it through the open window. Smash! The sound of a glass jar shattering is heard within the hut. Hermione ignores him and swiftly whistles a second stone through the window, hitting the back of Harry's head. Crows begin to drop atop the roof as Fudge's party arrives and raps on the door. Harry and Hermione watch themselves start up the slope, and with the coast clear, they slip out of the trees. As Harry vaults into the patch, the crows stir, cawing at his ankles and pecking at his feet. Buckbeak refuses to move. Harry and Hermione shoo Buckbeak along and disappear into the forest just as Dumbledore concludes his reverie. Harry and Hermione, their view unobstructed by the low stand of trees this time, watch the Executioner approach the pumpkin patch. Quickly, the confusion in his masked eyes turns to anger as the Executioner lifts his blade and, with a brutal fury, plunges it into the flesh of a pumpkin with a sickening chop. The crows scatter to the skies as Harry and Hermione race through the trees with Buckbeak loping easily behind. In a subjective point of view, they glide through a thicket of trees to the forest's edge where the trees thin, revealing the Whomping Willow thrashing. Hermione disappears down the hole, then a figure approaches the tree: Lupin.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: As Ron and Harry swap a inquisitive look, the bell persists to ring. At this moment, the time reversal concludes, and the chamber is vacant except for Harry and Hermione. As Hermione unloops the pendant, Harry gazes around in bewilderment while Hermione disregards the query and eyes the clock on the barrier. Hermione seizes Harry's limb and bursts through the entrance as they arrive to a frantic, panting stop. She raises up a palm, quieting him. Irritated, Harry trails her stare and blinks in astonishment as he perceives himself, alongside Hermione and Ron, about to face Malfoy, Crabbe, and Goyle near the monoliths. Astonished, Harry rotates as Hermione raises up the hourglass. A gentle slap is heard, and they pivot to observe Malfoy settle on the seat of his trousers in the Sundial Garden, rubbing his face. Hermione drags Harry under the arch, and moments afterward, steps clatter over their heads. Moments afterward, Harry surfaces and marvels at the spectacle of himself, Hermione, and Ron heading down the incline to Hagrid's cabin. His eyes shift to the squash patch, and Harry nods, then glances toward the cabin where Hagrid is handing Scabbers to Ron. As he starts to ascend, Hermione seizes him and speaks intensely, then observes Fudge and the others drawing nearer. She scowls and glances into the cabin. Just then, on the soil beside her, Hermione notices a jagged star-shaped rock and instantly seizes it, rises, and hurls it through the open casement. Smash! The noise of a glass vessel shattering is heard within the cabin. Hermione disregards him and quickly whistles a second rock through the casement, striking the back of Harry's head. Rooks begin to descend atop the roof as Fudge's group arrives and knocks on the door. Harry and Hermione observe themselves start up the incline, and with the coast clear, they slip out of the woods. As Harry leaps into the patch, the rooks stir, cawing at his ankles and pecking at his feet. Buckbeak declines to move. Harry and Hermione shoo Buckbeak along and vanish into the woods just as Dumbledore concludes his daydream. Harry and Hermione, their view unobstructed by the low stand of trees this time, observe the Executioner approach the squash patch. Quickly, the bewilderment in his masked eyes shifts to wrath as the Executioner raises his sword and, with a merciless savagery, drives it into the flesh of a squash with a sickening chop. The rooks scatter to the skies as Harry and Hermione dart through the woods with Buckbeak loping easily behind. In a subjective point of view, they glide through a copse of trees to the woods' boundary where the trees thin, revealing the Whomping Willow flailing. Hermione vanishes down the cavity, then a figure approaches the tree: Lupin.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: As a curious glance is exchanged by Ron and Harry, the bell is continuously chimed by it. At this point, the time reversal is ended, leaving the room empty except for Harry and Hermione. As the necklace is unlooped by Hermione, a glance around is given by Harry in confusion while the question is ignored by Hermione, whose eyes are on the clock on the wall. Harry’s arm is grabbed by Hermione and a mad, huffing halt is reached as they slam through the door. A hand is held up by her, silencing him. Her gaze is followed by an annoyed Harry, who blinks in disbelief as himself, along with Hermione and Ron, are seen by him, about to confront Malfoy, Crabbe, and Goyle near the monoliths. Dumbfounded, the hourglass is held up by Hermione as Harry turns. They turn as a soft smack is heard, and Malfoy is seen landing on the seat of his pants in the Sundial Garden, rubbing his kisser. Harry is pulled under the bridge by Hermione, and seconds later, footsteps are clamored over their heads. Seconds later, himself, Hermione, and Ron are marveled at by Harry as they emerge and head down the slope to Hagrid's hut. His eyes are shifted to the pumpkin patch, and a nod is given by Harry, then a look is cast toward the hut where Ron is handed Scabbers by Hagrid. As he starts to rise, Hermione fiercely grabs him and speaks, then watches as Fudge and the others draw closer. She frowns and glances into the hut. Just then, a jagged star-shaped stone beside her on the ground is noticed by Hermione, who instantly grabs it, rises, and hurls it through the open window. Smash! Within the hut, the sound of a glass jar shattering is heard. Hermione ignores him and swiftly whistles a second stone through the window, hitting the back of Harry's head. As Fudge's party arrives and raps on the door, crows begin to drop atop the roof. Themselves are watched by Harry and Hermione as they start up the slope, and with the coast clear, they slip out of the trees. As the patch is vaulted into by Harry, the crows are stirred, cawing at his ankles and pecking at his feet. Buckbeak is refused to be moved. Buckbeak is shooed along by Harry and Hermione, who disappear into the forest just as Dumbledore’s reverie is concluded. Harry and Hermione, with their view unobstructed by the low stand of trees this time, watch the Executioner approach the pumpkin patch. Quickly, the confusion in his masked eyes is turned to anger as his blade is lifted by the Executioner and, with brutal fury, the flesh of a pumpkin is plunged into it with a sickening chop. The skies are scattered to by the crows as Harry and Hermione, with Buckbeak loping easily behind, race through the trees. In a subjective point of view, a glide through a thicket of trees to the forest's edge is made where the trees thin, revealing the Whomping Willow thrashing. The hole is disappeared down by Hermione, then the tree is approached by a figure: Lupin.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: As Ron and Harry exchange a curious glance, the bell chimes. The time reversal ends, leaving the room empty except for Harry and Hermione. Hermione unloops the necklace, and Harry looks around confused. She grabs Harry's arm, pulling him through the door, and silences him. Annoyed, he sees himself, Hermione, and Ron about to confront Malfoy, Crabbe, and Goyle. Dumbfounded, Harry watches Hermione hold up the hourglass. They turn to see Malfoy land awkwardly in the Sundial Garden, rubbing his face. Hermione pulls Harry under the bridge, and footsteps clamor above. Harry marvels as he, Hermione, and Ron head to Hagrid's hut. His eyes shift to the pumpkin patch as Hagrid hands Scabbers to Ron. As he tries to rise, Hermione fiercely stops him, watching Fudge and others get closer. She finds a star-shaped stone, throws it through the open window, shattering a glass jar inside. Ignoring Harry, she throws another stone, hitting the back of his head. Crows descend as Fudge arrives and knocks. Harry and Hermione, clear to move, slip out of the trees. Harry jumps into the patch, stirring crows. Buckbeak hesitates, but Harry and Hermione shoo him into the forest as Dumbledore concludes his reverie. They watch the Executioner approach the patch, anger in his eyes, and furiously plunge a blade into a pumpkin. Crows scatter as Harry, Hermione, and Buckbeak race through the trees. They pass through the forest's edge, nearing the Whomping Willow, which thrashes wildly. Hermione disappears down a hole as Lupin approaches the tree.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: As Ron and Harry exchange glances, the bell chimes. The time reversal ends, leaving only Harry and Hermione. Hermione unloops her necklace, and Harry looks around confused. Ignoring his question, Hermione checks the clock and drags Harry through the door, silencing him with a hand. Annoyed, Harry sees himself, Hermione, and Ron confronting Malfoy, Crabbe, and Goyle. Dumbfounded, he turns as Hermione reveals the hourglass. They see Malfoy fall in the Sundial Garden. Hermione takes Harry under the bridge; footsteps follow overhead. Harry watches himself, Hermione, and Ron head to Hagrid's hut, noticing Hagrid giving Scabbers to Ron. As he rises, Hermione stops him, concerned about Fudge approaching. She finds a jagged stone, throws it through the window, smashing a jar. Ignoring Harry, she hurls another stone, hitting his past self. Crows land as Fudge knocks. With the coast clear, Harry and Hermione sneak out as Harry vaults into the patch, crows pecking at him. Buckbeak is urged into the forest as Dumbledore finishes reflecting. They watch the Executioner approach, mistaking the pumpkin for Buckbeak. He angrily chops it, scattering crows. Harry, Hermione, and Buckbeak race through trees to the forest's edge, reaching the Whomping Willow. Hermione disappears down a hole as Lupin approaches the tree.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: As Ron and Harry exchange a curious, questioning glance, the persistent bell continues to chime, filling the air with its unwavering sound. At this precise moment, the time reversal finally reaches its conclusion, leaving the room completely empty except for Harry and Hermione. As Hermione carefully unloops the delicate necklace from her neck, Harry glances around with a look of bewilderment, while Hermione, seemingly ignoring his unspoken question, casts her eyes towards the clock mounted on the wall. Abruptly, Hermione seizes Harry's arm, and together they slam through the door, coming to a mad, breathless halt. She raises a hand, effectively silencing him with her gesture, while an annoyed Harry tracks her gaze and blinks in disbelief. He witnesses himself, with Hermione and Ron, as they are about to confront Malfoy, Crabbe, and Goyle near the imposing monoliths. Dumbfounded, Harry turns as Hermione holds up the hourglass as if revealing a crucial secret. A soft smack resonates through the air, drawing their attention to Malfoy, who has landed on the seat of his pants in the Sundial Garden, gingerly rubbing his face. Hermione swiftly pulls Harry under the bridge, and mere seconds later, footsteps clamor noisily over their heads. Moments after, Harry emerges, marveling at the sight of himself, Hermione, and Ron making their way down the slope towards Hagrid's hut. His eyes shift to the pumpkin patch, and Harry nods in understanding, then looks toward the hut where Hagrid is seen handing Scabbers to Ron. As he begins to rise, Hermione grabs him tightly, speaking with fierce urgency, while she watches Fudge and the others drawing closer with determined steps. She frowns, thoughtfully glancing into the hut's interior. Just then, on the ground beside her, Hermione notices a jagged, star-shaped stone and instantly grabs it with purpose. Rising swiftly, she hurls the stone through the open window. Smash! The unmistakable sound of a glass jar shattering echoes from within the hut. Ignoring Harry's reaction, Hermione quickly whistles a second stone through the window, this time hitting the back of Harry's head with precision. Crows begin to drop atop the roof as Fudge's party arrives, rapping assertively on the door. Harry and Hermione watch as their past selves start up the slope, and once the coast is clear, they slip out stealthily from the cover of the trees. As Harry vaults into the pumpkin patch, the crows stir, cawing anxiously at his ankles and pecking at his feet. Buckbeak, initially stubborn, refuses to move. Harry and Hermione shoo Buckbeak along, urging him into action, and together they disappear into the dense forest just as Dumbledore concludes his reverie. Now, with their view unobstructed by the low stand of trees, Harry and Hermione watch the Executioner approach the pumpkin patch. Quickly, the confusion in his masked eyes transforms into anger as the Executioner lifts his formidable blade and, with brutal fury, plunges it into the flesh of a helpless pumpkin with a sickening chop. The startled crows scatter towards the skies as Harry and Hermione race through the trees with Buckbeak loping easily in their wake. From a subjective point of view, they seem to glide effortlessly through a thicket of trees to the forest's edge, where the trees begin to thin, revealing the Whomping Willow thrashing violently in the distance. Without hesitation, Hermione disappears down the hole just as a figure approaches the menacing tree: it is Lupin.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: In a moment of intrigue, as Ron and Harry exchange a glance filled with curiosity and questions, the persistent bell continues to chime. Its unwavering sound fills the air, resonating with an insistence that cannot be ignored. At this precise juncture, the time reversal, a mysterious process they have been caught within, finally reaches its conclusion. The room, which had been a hub of activity, now stands completely empty, with only Harry and Hermione remaining. As Hermione meticulously unloops the delicate necklace from around her neck, Harry casts a bewildered glance around the room. Hermione, on the other hand, seemingly dismissing his unspoken question, directs her attention towards the clock mounted prominently on the wall. Suddenly, with decisive urgency, Hermione seizes Harry's arm, and together they burst through the doorway, coming to a wild and breathless halt just beyond it. She raises a hand to effectively silence him with a simple gesture, while an annoyed Harry follows her gaze and blinks in utter disbelief. He witnesses a snapshot from another time: himself, alongside Hermione and Ron, poised to confront Malfoy, Crabbe, and Goyle near the intimidating monoliths. Dumbfounded by the sight, Harry turns just as Hermione lifts the hourglass into view, as though revealing a crucial secret to him. A quiet but decisive smack echoes through the air, catching their attention as Malfoy lands unceremoniously on the seat of his pants in the Sundial Garden, gingerly rubbing his face. In a swift motion, Hermione pulls Harry under the bridge, and in mere seconds, the clamor of footsteps reverberates noisily above their heads. Moments later, Harry emerges, marveling at the sight of himself, Hermione, and Ron making their way down the slope towards Hagrid's hut. His eyes drift to the pumpkin patch, and Harry nods in understanding, then shifts his gaze towards the hut where Hagrid is in the act of handing Scabbers to Ron. As he begins to rise, Hermione grips him tightly, speaking to him with fierce urgency, her eyes fixed on Fudge and the others as they advance with determined steps. Hermione frowns, casting a thoughtful glance into the interior of the hut. Just then, on the ground beside her, Hermione spots a jagged, star-shaped stone and instinctively grabs it with purpose. Rising swiftly, she hurls the stone through the open window. Smash! The unmistakable sound of a glass jar shattering echoes from within the hut. Ignoring Harry's reaction, Hermione quickly sends a second stone whistling through the window, this time striking the back of Harry's head with precise accuracy. As crows begin to descend atop the roof, Fudge's party arrives, rapping assertively on the door. Harry and Hermione watch intently as their past selves begin their ascent up the slope, and once the immediate danger has passed, they slip out stealthily from the cover of the trees. As Harry leaps into the pumpkin patch, the crows stir, cawing anxiously around his ankles and pecking determinedly at his feet. Buckbeak, initially showing stubborn refusal, remains unmoved. Harry and Hermione shoo Buckbeak along, urging him into action, and together they vanish into the dense forest just as Dumbledore concludes his contemplative reverie. Now, with their view unobstructed by the low stand of trees, Harry and Hermione watch as the Executioner approaches the pumpkin patch. Quickly, the confusion in his masked eyes transforms into seething anger. The Executioner, with brutal fury, raises his formidable blade and plunges it into the flesh of an innocent pumpkin with a sickening chop. Startled, the crows scatter towards the skies as Harry and Hermione race through the trees with Buckbeak loping easily at their side. From a subjective point of view, they seem to glide effortlessly through a dense thicket of trees to the forest's edge, where the trees begin to thin out, revealing the Whomping Willow thrashing violently in the distance. Without a moment's hesitation, Hermione disappears down the hole just as a figure approaches the menacing tree: it is none other than Lupin.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As Ron and Harry exchange a curious glance, each taking a moment to try to understand the situation, the bell continues to chime persistently, creating a backdrop of anticipation. At this point, the effects of the time reversal cease, leaving the room empty except for Harry and Hermione, with the lingering echoes of the chime fading into silence. Hermione carefully unloops the necklace from around their necks, while Harry, with a puzzled look, scans the room trying to comprehend their new reality. Meanwhile, Hermione, choosing to focus on their objective, glances at the clock on the wall, ignoring Harry's unspoken questions. With determination, Hermione grips Harry's arm firmly and propels him through the door, moving with urgency until they come to a swift, breathless stop. She gestures for silence with a raised hand, preventing Harry from speaking out and disturbing their hidden presence. Annoyed but curious, Harry obediently follows her gaze, and his eyes widen in disbelief as he observes himself, accompanied by Hermione and Ron, preparing to confront Malfoy, Crabbe, and Goyle near the monoliths. With confusion and amazement, Harry turns his attention to Hermione, who holds the hourglass aloft, confirming their successful time travel. At that moment, a soft smack is heard, prompting them to shift their focus and see Malfoy landing unceremoniously on the seat of his pants in the Sundial Garden, tenderly rubbing his face. Hermione, maintaining their low profile, pulls Harry under the bridge as the sound of footsteps clamor above them. Moments later, Harry emerges and is struck with amazement as he sees himself, along with Hermione and Ron, making their way down the slope toward Hagrid's hut. His attention drifts to the pumpkin patch as Harry nods in understanding, mentally piecing together their timeline, then shifts his gaze to the hut where he observes Hagrid handing Scabbers to Ron. As he begins to rise with the intent to act, Hermione restrains him, speaking fiercely to convey the seriousness of their mission as they watch Fudge and his party approach closer. Hermione, concerned, glances into the hut, strategizing their next move. Just then, her eyes catch sight of a jagged star-shaped stone on the ground beside her, prompting an instant decision. She grabs the stone, rises swiftly, and with precise aim, hurls it through the open window. The sudden sound of glass shattering accompanies the smash, echoing within the hut. Ignoring any immediate consequences, Hermione swiftly sends a second stone sailing through the window, striking the back of Harry's head in a calculated accident. The disturbance causes crows to descend onto the roof as Fudge's party reaches the door and knocks. With intense focus, Harry and Hermione watch their past selves begin their ascent up the slope. Sensing the opportunity, they discreetly emerge from the trees once the coast is clear. Harry vaults into the pumpkin patch, causing the crows to react, flapping around his ankles and pecking at his feet in irritation. Meanwhile, Buckbeak stands stubbornly, refusing to move, necessitating Harry and Hermione to coax him along as they disappear into the forest. They move swiftly, just as Dumbledore ends his contemplative observation. As they proceed, unobstructed by the low stand of trees this time, they watch the Executioner approach the pumpkin patch with a menacing demeanor. The Executioner's eyes, initially confused, transform to anger as he raises his blade with a threatening resolve, then drives it fiercely into a pumpkin, the action punctuated by a sickening crunch. Instantly, the crows respond by scattering into the sky, alarmed by the sudden violence. In response, Harry and Hermione race through the trees, with Buckbeak effortlessly loping behind them. From their subjective vantage point, they glide through a dense thicket of trees to the forest's edge, where the trees begin to thin, revealing the Whomping Willow violently thrashing in the open. Hermione quickly disappears into the hole beneath the tree, her presence vanishing as a figure, identified as Lupin, approaches the formidable tree.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: As the bell continues to chime, Ron and Harry exchange a curious glance before the room empties, leaving only Harry and Hermione. Hermione unloops the necklace, and Harry glances around in confusion. Ignoring his question, Hermione checks the clock, then grabs Harry's arm, leading him through the door to a halt. She silences him with a raised hand, and Harry follows her gaze in disbelief as he sees themselves about to confront Malfoy, Crabbe, and Goyle. Hermione shows Harry the hourglass, and they watch Malfoy land in the Sundial Garden. Pulling Harry under a bridge, they dodge footsteps overhead. Emerging, Harry sees his past self heading to Hagrid's hut, noticing Ron receiving Scabbers from Hagrid. Hermione grabs him as Fudge and others approach, then hurls a stone through the hut's window, shattering glass. Ignoring Harry’s reaction, she throws a second stone, hitting the back of his past self's head. As Fudge's party arrives, Harry and Hermione slip out of the trees, stirring crows as they vault into the pumpkin patch. They urge Buckbeak forward into the forest as Dumbledore finishes his reverie. Watching the Executioner approach, they hide as he angrily chops a pumpkin, scattering crows. Harry and Hermione, with Buckbeak loping behind, race through the forest. Near the Whomping Willow, Hermione disappears down a hole as Lupin approaches the tree.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: As Ron and Harry exchange a curious glance, the bell, reminiscent of the old Hogwarts clock tower signaling class changes, continues to chime. At this point, the time reversal, facilitated by the magical Time-Turner—a device used for time travel at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry—ends, and the room is empty except for Harry and Hermione. As Hermione unloops the necklace that contains the Time-Turner, Harry glances around in confusion while Hermione, known for her quick thinking, ignores the question and eyes the clock on the wall. Hermione grabs Harry's arm and slams through the door as they come to a mad, huffing halt. She holds up a hand, silencing him. Annoyed, Harry follows her gaze and blinks in disbelief as he sees himself, along with Hermione and Ron, his closest allies at Hogwarts, about to confront Malfoy, Crabbe, and Goyle, who are well-known for their antagonistic behavior, near the monoliths in the school courtyard. Dumbfounded, Harry turns as Hermione holds up the hourglass, a symbol of their recent time journey. A soft smack is heard, and they turn to see Malfoy land on the seat of his pants in the Sundial Garden, a peaceful spot next to the Herbology greenhouses, rubbing his kisser. Hermione pulls Harry under the bridge, a structure arching over the Black Lake footpath, and seconds later, footsteps clamor over their heads. Seconds later, Harry emerges and marvels at the sight of himself, Hermione, and Ron heading down the slope to Hagrid's hut, a simple wooden cabin where the half-giant groundskeeper lives. His eyes shift to the pumpkin patch, tended by Hagrid for magical creatures, and Harry nods, then looks toward the hut where Hagrid is handing Scabbers, Ron's pet rat with a mysterious past, to Ron. As he starts to rise, Hermione grabs him and speaks fiercely, aware of the urgency, then watches Fudge, the Minister of Magic, and the others drawing closer. She frowns and glances into the hut. Just then, on the ground beside her, Hermione notices a jagged star-shaped stone, reminiscent of the ones used in ancient wizard duels, and instantly grabs it, rises, and hurls it through the open window. Smash! The sound of a glass jar, possibly containing one of Hagrid's unusual potions, shattering is heard within the hut. Hermione ignores him and swiftly whistles a second stone through the window, hitting the back of Harry's head. Crows, often drawn to noisy commotion, begin to drop atop the roof as Fudge's party arrives and raps on the door. Harry and Hermione watch themselves start up the slope, and with the coast clear, they slip out of the trees. As Harry vaults into the patch, the crows stir, cawing at his ankles and pecking at his feet. Buckbeak, the proud hippogriff whose life depends on their mission, refuses to move. Harry and Hermione shoo Buckbeak along and disappear into the forest just as Dumbledore, the wise headmaster with a penchant for observing events unfold, concludes his reverie. Harry and Hermione, their view unobstructed by the low stand of trees this time, watch the Executioner, a dark figure tasked with carrying out magical sentences, approach the pumpkin patch. Quickly, the confusion in his masked eyes turns to anger as the Executioner lifts his blade and, with a brutal fury, plunges it into the flesh of a pumpkin with a sickening chop. The crows scatter to the skies as Harry and Hermione race through the trees with Buckbeak loping easily behind. In a subjective point of view, they glide through a thicket of trees to the forest's edge where the trees thin, revealing the Whomping Willow thrashing, a notoriously violent tree guarding a secret passage. Hermione disappears down the hole, then a figure approaches the tree: Lupin, their trusted professor and a friend with a complex past.

Harry and Hermione shoo Buckbeak along and disappear into the forest just as Dumbledore concludes his reverie. Harry and Hermione their view unobstructed by the low stand of trees. this time. watch the Executioner approach the pumpkin patch. Quickly the confusion in his masked eyes turns to anger as the Executioner lifts his blade and with a brutal fury plunges it into the flesh of a pumpkin with a sickening chop. The crows scatter to the skies as Harry and Hermione race through the trees with Buckbeak loping easily behind. In a subjective point of view they glide through a thicket of trees to the forest's edge where the trees thin revealing the Whomping Willow thrashing. Hermione disappears down the hole. then a figure approaches the tree. Lupin.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: As Ron and Harry exchange a curious glance the bell continues to chime. At this point the time reversal ends and the room is empty except for Harry and Hermione. As Hermione unloops the necklace Harry glances around in confusion while Hermione ignores the question and eyes the clock on the wall. Hermione grabs Harry's arm and slams through the door as they come to a mad huffing halt. She holds up a hand silencing him. Annoyed Harry follows her gaze and blinks in disbelief as he sees himself along with Hermione and Ron about to confront Malfoy. Crabbe and Goyle near the monoliths. Dumbfounded Harry turns as Hermione holds up the hourglass. A soft smack is heard and they turn to see Malfoy land on the seat of his pants in the Sundial Garden rubbing his kisser. Hermione pulls Harry under the bridge and seconds later footsteps clamor over their heads. Seconds later Harry emerges and marvels at the sight of himself. Hermione and Ron heading down the slope to Hagrid's hut. His eyes shift to the pumpkin patch and Harry nods. then looks toward the hut where Hagrid is handing Scabbers to Ron. As he starts to rise Hermione grabs him and speaks fiercely then watches Fudge and the others drawing closer. She frowns and glances into the hut. Just then on the ground beside her Hermione notices a jagged starshaped stone and instantly grabs it rises and hurls it through the open window. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. Smash. The sound of a glass jar shattering is heard within the hut. Hermione ignores him and swiftly whistles a second stone through the window hitting the back of Harry's head. Crows begin to drop atop the roof as Fudge's party arrives and raps on the door. Harry and Hermione watch themselves start up the slope and with the coast clear they slip out of the trees. As Harry vaults into the patch the crows stir cawing at his ankles and pecking at his feet. Buckbeak refuses to move. Harry and Hermione shoo Buckbeak along and disappear into the forest just as Dumbledore concludes his reverie. Harry and Hermione their view unobstructed by the low stand of trees. this time. watch the Executioner approach the pumpkin patch. Quickly the confusion in his masked eyes turns to anger as the Executioner lifts his blade and with a brutal fury plunges it into the flesh of a pumpkin with a sickening chop. The crows scatter to the skies as Harry and Hermione race through the trees with Buckbeak loping easily behind. In a subjective point of view they glide through a thicket of trees to the forest's edge where the trees thin revealing the Whomping Willow thrashing. Hermione disappears down the hole. then a figure approaches the tree. Lupin.

As Hermione unloops the necklace Harry glances around in confusion while Hermione ignores the question and eyes the clock on the wall. Hermione grabs Harry's arm and slams through the door as they come to a mad huffing halt. Hermione disappears down the hole. then a figure approaches the tree. Lupin.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: As Greg and Tom exchange a bewildered nod, the siren continues to buzz. At this juncture, the spell dissolves, and the arena is vacant except for Tom and Lucy. As Lucy disentangles the bracelet, Tom scans the surroundings in puzzlement while Lucy disregards the inquiry and locks eyes with the calendar on the ceiling. Lucy snatches Tom's shoulder and barges through the gate as they skid to a frantic, panting stop. She raises a finger, quieting him. Frustrated, Tom trails her stare and squints in astonishment as he spots himself, along with Lucy and Greg, preparing to face Drake, Vince, and Mark near the pillars. Astounded, Tom pivots as Lucy raises the stopwatch. A gentle pop is detected, and they swivel to observe Drake landing on the cushion of his trousers in the Sundial Park, massaging his snout. Lucy drags Tom beneath the pier, and moments later, footsteps clatter over their scalps. Quickly after, Tom pops out and gawks at the spectacle of himself, Lucy, and Greg descending toward Douglas's cabin. His focus shifts to the cornfield, and Tom grins, then peers toward the cabin where Douglas is passing a rodent to Greg. As he begins to lift, Lucy clutches him and murmurs urgently, then observes Fudge and the companions inching closer. She grimaces and peers inside the cabin. Suddenly, on the earth beside her, Lucy spots a jagged moon-shaped pebble and instantly snatches it, stands, and flings it through the ajar portal. Crash! The clatter of a porcelain vase splintering is heard inside the cabin. Lucy overlooks him and briskly tosses a second pebble through the portal, striking the back of Tom's cranium. Pigeons commence to descend atop the ceiling as Fudge's assemblage appears and taps on the gate. Tom and Lucy observe themselves ascend the hill, and with the terrain open, they slip from the bushes. As Tom leaps into the field, the pigeons flutter, pecking at his toes and nibbling at his knees. Swoop refuses to budge. Tom and Lucy prod Swoop along and vanish into the woods just as Dumbledore wraps up his musings. Tom and Lucy, their vista unobstructed by the diminutive stretch of bushes this round, observe the Punisher advancing toward the cornfield. Swiftly, the perplexity in his hidden gaze morphs to wrath as the Punisher heaves his cleaver and, with merciless vigor, plunges it into the rind of a melon with a nauseating slice. The pigeons disperse to the heavens as Tom and Lucy dash through the bushes with Swoop galloping effortlessly behind. In a subjective glance, they cruise through a cluster of bushes to the woodland's perimeter where the bushes thin, unveiling the Flailing Fir flailing. Lucy vanishes down the tunnel, then a silhouette strides toward the sapling: Wolf.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: As the bell chimes, Ron and Harry exchange glances, ending the time reversal with only Harry and Hermione in the room. Hermione unloops a necklace, ignores Harry's confusion, and focuses on the clock. She pulls Harry along, silencing him, as they encounter themselves confronting Malfoy and his friends. They watch Malfoy fall in the Sundial Garden, then hide under a bridge, observing themselves heading to Hagrid’s hut. Noticing danger, Hermione hurls a stone, shattering glass inside the hut. Fudge arrives, and Harry and Hermione slip away with Buckbeak into the forest. After the Executioner furiously hacks a pumpkin, sending crows flying, Harry and Hermione race with Buckbeak to the forest. As the trees thin at the forest's edge, they see the Whomping Willow thrashing, and Hermione disappears down a hole as Lupin approaches.
